dcterms:description: BME (Begin-Middle-End) is a synthetic univariate dataset provided by Laboratoire d’informatique de Grenoble (LIG), at Université Grenoble Alpes. It contains three classes characterized by the presence or absence of a positive peak at the beginning or end of the series.
dcterms:title: BME Dataset

dcterms:creator: R. Olszewski
R. Maxion
D. Siewiorek
dcterms:description: The ECG200 dataset consists of univariate time series, each representing a subsequence of an electrocardiogram corresponding to a single heartbeat. It includes two classes: normal heart rhythm and myocardial infarction.
dcterms:title: ECG200 Dataset

dcterms:creator: M. Wilhelm
D. Krakowczyk
F. Trollmann
S. Albayrak
dcterms:description: The ERing dataset is composed of multivariate time series in 4 dimensions that characterize captured hand and finger gestures belonging to 6 categories. The data were captured using a finger ring and an electromagnetic sensor.
dcterms:title: ERing Dataset

dcterms:description: The datasets made up of multivariate time series on which the evaluation is carried out are those used in a previous study (Baldán and Benítez, 2021). These are 30 datasets from various fields (economy, health, biology, energy, industry, etc.), freely accessible on the UEA archive.
dcterms:title: Various datasets from UEA repository
